alert.note: Alert for Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:19PM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey, Mercer and Monmouth. In southern New Jersey, Burlington. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM EST, Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - For Crosswicks Creek at Extonville: At 8:00pm the stage was 13.37 feet. Flood Stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
